page.title: 08PILGRIMS WAY THRO' CATERHAM
page.content:
PILGRIMS WAY goes from Guildford to Canterbury. The pilgrims would sometimes get lost, so they planted YEW TREES along the way. The Pilgrims Way took many years to complete, it was made in MEDIEVAL TIMES.
To pass the time the pilgrims would take it in turns to tell stories or tales. These stories are filled with details of everyday life in the 14th Century.
Some people, instead of telling stories, would sing, or play a musical instrument.
From WHITE HILL to VIEW POINT I counted 366 yew trees, this shows that it was part of the original Pilgrims Way.
